page.title: 01Flookburgh and Allithwaite
page.content: On the northern shore of{Morecambe {Bay}you will find a small peninsula bounded by the estuaries of the rivers Kent and Leven.At the southern end of this peninsula are the rural villages of{Flookburgh}and{Allithwaite.}Close by are Cark-in-Cartmel,Ravenstown and Kents Bank. The land near the coast is flat,with extensive marshes.Inland there is a hilly area of limestone running out to a distictive point,{Humphrey Head.}The farmers have preserved the traditional landscape,there are many hedgerows and small lanes. The villages have many buildings that date from the 17th century. The area is quiet,pretty and interesting. Many people visit this area for its own sake or because it provides an excellent base for exploring the{Lake {District}and{South Lakeland.
